column4: I want to uninstall mysql-server and reinstall it.  Where are the files associated with the databases so I can back them up just in case?
uninstalling something and reinstalling is unlikely to accomplish much.  /Why/ do you want to do so?
After upgrading 9.04 to 9.10 mysql won't start.  Gstar tried to help me but we ran out of things to try and very little help from my logs.
It just says it failed.  Log files here http://pastebin.com/m707b199
were you using unofficial repositories or debs?
Not that I know of, other than mutlimedia (dvd stuff)
Trying to research which version of MySQL is needed for MythTV
umm, why would it be stupid?  It's explicitly supported...
M'Kay.  Reading the docs it says to go one revision upgrade at a time, and I guess I could do that, but it seems like an awful lot has changed between those releases.
no, LTS -> LTS is explicitly supported
(i.e. you do not need to go to 10.10, 11.04, and 11.10 in between)
and?  That page should confirm (or at the very least not contradict) what I've told you
Ah, I see the second part of that sentence where it says you can go from LTS to LTS.  Thank you for pointing that out.
yep, one of the big benefits of LTS
beat me to most of it.
